result.execSummary:
The defendant Angelia D Gatson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Buy Money to be paid to Waukesha Police Dept.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain/Obtain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Provide DNA sample, if not yet provided.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time (nonworking hours) Standard release. Last 10 days STAYED and to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to huber or straight time.

records.addlTxt: Denying Defendant's request for electronic monitoring.
Dated June 18, 2015 filed by the Defendant requesting the Court grant electronic monitoring.

The Defendant may be released from the Huber Facility an additional two hours a day on work days to allow for travel to her place of employment in River Hills, Wisconsin.  Signed by Judge Aprhamian on 6/12/15.
Filed by the Defendant requesting additional release time for travel.
from Megan P. - Director of Operations -  filed by Defense Counsel

Defendant Angelia D Gatson in court with attorney Patricia M. Padurean.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1.


Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 3 years 6 months (Initial Confinement: 18 months, Extended Supervision: 2 years)  Stayed for 5 years Probation - concurrent with present sentence
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Buy Money of $705.00 to be paid to Waukesha Police Department as a Condition of Probation.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.   No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided.
 - 45 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing 06/15/2015 by 6:00 p.m..  Non-working hours with standard release conditions. Last 10 days jail  STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion.
Sentencing hearing on June 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.
